title: Swap site logo and favicon to uploaded MR icon-1.png

requirements.summary: Add MR icon-1.png to public assets and use it as the logo in the site header and footer.
acceptanceCriteria: The file MR icon-1.png is present in the frontend public assets directory (served under /assets/...).
SiteHeader renders MR icon-1.png as the logo image and no longer references the previous logo filename.
SiteFooter renders MR icon-1.png as the logo image and no longer references the previous logo filename.
Logo images render without 404s in both local dev and production build (verify via browser Network tab).

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded image file to the public static assets directory so it is served under /assets/ and can be referenced by UI components.
Replace the current logo asset reference with getPublicAssetUrl('MR icon-1.png') so the header uses the uploaded MR icon as the brand logo. Ensure the previous logo filename is no longer referenced.
Replace the current logo asset reference with getPublicAssetUrl('MR icon-1.png') so the footer uses the uploaded MR icon as the brand logo. Ensure the previous logo filename is no longer referenced.

requirements.summary: Update favicon links to reference MR icon-1.png with correct URL encoding.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html favicon links reference MR icon-1.png under /assets/ (with correct URL encoding).
After a hard refresh, the browser tab icon uses MR icon-1.png.
No favicon-related 404s occur in the browser Network tab.

file_operations.description: Update favicon link href values to use the uploaded asset under /assets/ with proper URL encoding for spaces (e.g., MR%20icon-1.png), replacing the current favicon filename references.
